revised_title: Influence of Second Harmonic Term on One-Dimensional Dislocations
tldr: The authors investigate the properties of one-dimensional dislocations and the influence of the second harmonic term in the potential representation. They find that when the amplitude of the second harmonic term is large, a complete dislocation splits into two halves, affecting the equilibrium separation and stability conditions. This study has implications for understanding dislocations in materials science and crystallography.
